thread.title_full: ​How to Make Thai Peanut Noodles With Chicken and Scallions​ | Men’s Health

title: ​How to Make Thai Peanut Noodles With Chicken and Scallions​ | Men’s Health
text:
Enjoy without the guilt of departed puppies. Thai Peanut Noodles With Chicken and Scallions 
What You’ll Need: 
3 Tbsp creamy peanut butter 
2 Tbsp low-sodium soy sauce 
1 Tbsp fresh lime juice 
1 to 2 tsp sriracha 
1 tsp dark brown sugar 
1 tsp toasted sesame oil 
2 cups shredded rotisserie chicken 
4 thinly slices scallions 
How to Make It: 
1. Cook the spaghetti according to package directions until al dente; reserve 1/4 cup cooking water and drain the noodles. 
2. In a large, whisk together the peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, sriracha, sugar, sesame oil, and enough of the reserved water so that the mixture is smooth (you may not use all the water). Add the noodles to the bowl and toss in the sauce until well coated. Toss in the chicken and half the scallions. Divide among 2 bowls and top with the remaining scallions. Serves 2 
Nutrition per serving: 634 calories, 59g protein, 54g carbohydrates (9g fiber), 20g fat
